instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND: What is PP2V5_NAND? PP2V5_NAND is a power rail that powers the NAND memory for the soldered on SSD of newer macbooks and must be present for the internal SSD to work. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot loop
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bootloop

Client said he just close the lid and went for launch.
When come back there was black screen and boot loop.

There is boot loop even when lid is closed until battery is flat.


Client need data and it is detected in DFU but every time during 'Revive' it will reboot so device process is canceled.

There is half of chime sound and reboot.

<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND</SIGNAL> got 2.5V

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot loop
threads.message: Can you put the machine in target disk mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot loop
threads.message:
Target Disk Mode successful - data copied.

Restore in DFU then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot loop
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot loop
threads.message:
Restore successful.
All works fine with fresh system.

Many thanks :)
